title: Qantas unveils plush new lounge
text:
Welcome ... Qantas' new business lounge at Perth Airport Picture: Supplied. Source: Supplied 
THE future of flying looks like this — at least for business class travellers. 
Qantas has tonight opened its swish new business lounge at Perth Domestic Airport and declared it to be the new benchmark for airport lounges in Australia. 
With three distinctive zones for work, rest and dining, the lounge has seating for more than 350. Slick and modern ... Qantas' new lounge at Perth Domestic Airport. Picture: Supplied. Source: Supplied 
It also features an Australia-first “pizza bar” with its own pizza chef, plus a wine bar and a make-your-own juice station. 
“The lounge has been designed with our most frequent travellers from Western Australia in mind,” said Qantas Domestic CEO Andrew David. 
“It accommodates a mix of corporate, leisure and Fly-In, Fly-Out workers with business facilities, a sports lounge to relax and socialise and dining areas with single and communal seating.” Gourmet ... Qantas' new domestic business lounge at Perth Airport is the first in the country to offer a "pizza bar" with its own pizza chef. Picture: Supplied. Source: Supplied 
The lounge opening follows on from the installation of new business class suites on Qantas A330s flying in and out of Perth. 
The lie-flat seats are positioned in a 1-2-1 configuration to give every passenger aisle access, and more room to work and sleep. 
Virgin Australia has also significantly upgraded its business class seats on A330s, and added the world’s first aerospace designed coffee machines to the pointy end of the plane. 
Australian Business Traveller editor David Flynn said the strategy being employed by both airlines was all about the length of the flight and the size of the premium market willing to pay the extra. Bigger ... Qantas's new business lounge at Perth Domestic Airport has seating for more than 350. Picture: Supplied. Source: Supplied 
“While some of the heat has gone out of the resource market the east-west route continues to be a lucrative one,” said Mr Flynn. 
“The five-hour plus duration of transcontinental flights compared with Sydney-Melbourne or Sydney-Brisbane, makes the lure of business class more appealing especially on those overnight red-eye flights.” Stylish ... Qantas’s new business lounge at Perth Airport has three distinct areas for work, relaxing and dining. Picture: Supplied. Source: Supplied 
He said Perth was long overdue to get a Qantas business lounge given the number of business class travellers and top-tier frequent flyers jetting back and forth between the coasts. 
In November, Virgin will open its new terminal at Perth Airport with two lounges — one for frequent flyers and business class customers, and another for invitation only guests and VIPs. 
The average cost of a one-way business class fare for Sydney-Perth flights is $2000 compared with $300 to $500 for economy class.
